title: Review: This Time, ‘A Raisin in the Sun’ Really Does Explode
description: Lorraine Hansberry’s 1959 classic ends on a note of cautious optimism. Its latest incarnation, at the Public Theater, does not.
dc:creator: Jesse Green
media:description: From left: Mandi Masden, Francois Battiste, Tonya Pinkins and Paige Gilbert in a revival of Lorraine Hansberry’s “A Raisin in the Sun,” directed by Robert O’Hara, at the Public Theater.
